title: Do you have any idea about Whitehat Jr. online coding class for kids? Is it genuine or fake? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm currently working as a Computer Science Intern, and we do a lot of researches about online coding websites. There are a lot of sites that provide great online coding classes for kids. But especially focusing on coding, there isn't a single one apart from WhiteHat Jr. I have done a lot of research on WhiteHat Jr, as one of my cousins was curious to join some online coding classes, during this pandemic. When I was asked to help him, I felt I should give all my research abilities a test and help him. At the same time, I even thought inclination towards this field will definitely help him after and during this ongoing situation. As per my point of view, WhiteHat Jr is genuine and purely sticking to its commitments. The testimonial I read about WhiteHat Jr on their website, Facebook Page, Instagram, etc. are all genuine. Working at Facebook has a little perk that I was able to contact the kid's parents. The kid is currently learning to code at WhiteHat Jr. To my astonishment, I was impressed with the review as well as the apps that a kid of mere age 9 created. When I talked with her ( Navya Jha ), she said "Before I fell in love with the word 'WhiteHatJr', little did I know it would provide me the master key to code. Though I knew computers for a long time WhiteHat Jr helped me to know it's soul through engaging experiments". She was really happy and was always looking forward to her classes. The classes are 1:1 between the student and teacher, thus, the child doesn't get conscious, the doubts get cleared as well as the clarity in teaching. After the phone call ended, I did a little more research and got to know that they even provide demo classes, to help you decide whether to enroll or not. WhiteHat Jr has divided the curriculum into 5 parts which are suitable for each age group- Beginners (Grade-1), Intermediate (Grade 2-3), Advance (4-6), Professional (Grade 7-9) and Applied Tech (Grade 10-12+). Thus, according to me, it's a great website and a must-try. I hope with my answer I was able to help you.

If scam had a synonym it would be white hat jr. The company which claims to provide coding classes to children by telling fancy shit. My cousin who got obsessed with computer found this shit on well everywhere . Maybe he is excited to get a job like white hat jr wolf gupta or maybe he got bored from firecrackers so this Diwali he decided to burn money and that is where white hat jr comes into play. Basically it is a new scam pulled by byjus after all you gotta recover some money after an all out cash deal which went into buying white hat jr.  I think they are waiting wolf gupta to be old enough to buy white hat jr and it is a acquisition which was taken to make profit in long run. So this app forces you to buy classes which are ridiculously expensive and Coursera and udemy even you tube has better content than it . It is a joke and is a pathetic copy of scratch an application developed by MIT which by the way is free to download. Or you could go to Learn computer science. Change the world. which offers an awesome experience . White hat jr is just a tool by byjus to lure gullible parents into their trap by making tall claims.  Looking at their advertisement which tells way more about their teacher selection criteria. Who wouldn't want such a cushy job ? And their certificate basically has probably the same value as a printed paper which is 20 inr tops. Look I am just being honest here coding requires a certain amount of practice and all white hat provides is basic knowledge and certain templates which you could find for free on you tube. I found it shocking that platforms like white hat are getting this much attention whereas real heroes like khan academy and Coursera are not getting its share due to cheap marketing gimmicks which are employed by certain overvalued edtech companies. White hat jr is overvalued like it's parent company byjus and it is not worth it. My advice is to burn your money like joker in dark knight than buying this course .

I found this company through a add & was immediately excited for my 7 year old son, since coding will be very uselful for him. What are definitely fake, are the sales people trying to con you. This is the reason I did not pursue this company, rather joined a rival and both me & my child are very happy. Things the sales representative hid or did not inform for me to take a informed decision: Spoke for good 4–5 hours repeating the same things, omitted to mention rivals when asked.Kept pushing for the 200 hour course since that includes some trip to nasa or something, obviously thats the most expensive one.When I was about to give credit card details, I happened to ask how long will we have to finish the course, did he reluctantly inform the course needs to be finished in 1 year.That works out to minimum of 4 hours per week, which I guess for a 7 year old sounds, I don't know, a little bit too much.Kept selling “robotics” “nasa” “amazon” as if any of those things will permeate throught to a 7 year old.In conclusion, I found this company extremely untrustworthy, for us this did not make sense. The rival, has coding packages according to age, this is working out since my child can have a introductory course, as well as only once a week to start, and take a specific course for scratch since for his age, this level of difficulty is enough, rather than “robotics” etc. LoL.

To all those who are praising WhiteHat Jr. There are IIT Bombay, IIT Delhi computer science graduates who land a fresher job in Google with a package that is not even 1 Cr most of the times. And here there is an ad of an online enterprise that assures that a kid can earn 150 cr from google just by making some apps and websites. Any sane person wouldn't believe whatever WhiteHat Jr. is serving to indian parents. The next point being, even if you are remotely technical you might know that google, facebook and all these big IT gaints have a well defined recruitment process that tests your knowledge of Data Structures and Algorithmic questions. They almost never test your knowledge about an technology/framework to make an app/website. In short, white hat Jr. is teaching kids to integrate components and create an app that's all, which certainly is NOT CODING. Coding involves logical thinking and problem solving abilities and not knowledge of React Native or Flutter. White Hat Jr. is teaching kids technologies that are most probably going to be obselete by the time these kids get ready for a real job. As an example, java and .NET were pretty famous around 2013–14 now everyone is crazy about JavaScript Frameworks and Cloud Technologies. And yes please don't put the argument that this helps the kids in logical reasoning. Knowledge of making a simple app just by following instructions of some mentor isn't logical reasoning. And if so, why not make these kids compete on Codeforces or Topcoder against 7 year old Russian kids would be doing algorithmic problems, who are of course better than Indian kids. And yaa recently saw an advertisement for White Hat Jr. saying teachers required but coding skills are not necessary. That pretty much sums it up, the startup shows the teachers what steps they need to follow to make an app and the teacher intern shows it to students thus finally satisfying brown parent's hunger of “mera beta sharma ji ke bete se better hai”. PS : Agar Chintu 150 cr kama sakta hai to uska teacher 30k kyu kamata hai??
